body_content.explanation: laws, rules, or official policies in a society that result in and support a continued unfair advantage to some people and unfair or harmful treatment of others based on race:
examples: Structural racism is at the root of the differences in access to healthcare.
The fundamental problem of American democracy is the problem of structural racism: the deep patterns of socioeconomic inequality and disadvantage due to race.
It is gratifying to see so many people acknowledging the reality of personal, societal and structural racism.
